text: This is the absolute best time to invest... ...in education: http://blockchaintraining.org/schedule #bitcoin #ethereum #lightning #blockchain #education #BTC2019

You want constrained deterministic supply, Bitcoin or then gold. After that property, stock indexes, high rated bonds, Swiss francs. Ethereum with a few programmers is bottom of list places to store value, fiat monetary policy committees at least have a stated policy & economists
“Only through sharding” seems pretty myopic tbh... we’re supposed to be technologists, not archaeologists. Sharding is pretty old school, imho.
But it will be ready in 18 months time and you can retweet this again then, and it will still be true
Let’s do the math on that. How many transactions a day do you think 1bn people would do. How many bytes per transaction?
Why use a blockchain with l2 if you can just use a database?
Huh? Any privacy that can be added to BTC can be added to an ethereum transaction or sidechains, correct? Is there a zero knowledge proof that works on bitcoin but not ethereum?

It's very weird to attack usage on ethereum for anything where usage on bitcoin is even lower. I'm not even sure what that means. But, more broadly, I reject the perpetual framing. If we're talking about the SoV use case, that's one thing. If we're talking about the entire

3/ telling people that an ethereum dApp with non-trivial usage is "unwanted" or "unneeded" when no one has yet been able to launch the equivalent in stable form on Bitcoin just doesn't make sense. Consumers are showing what they want, and getting it where it exists.

Better in all regards....except it doesn't exist. No one is disputing the math. But I was having this exact same debate in 2016. All that stuff being built on ethereum? Not necessary, just build it on Bitcoin. Except...it doesn't exist. It will exist someday, but that delta,
Oh come on, it'd be a great proof of concept to show how anything you can do on ethereum you can readily do on Bitcoin too.

Not at all. I'm arguing that there's clear demand for a variety of services on Bitcoin. But it's so hard to produce them, that despite nearly unlimited funding, only some are being built, and slowly. We don't "need" ethereum for a specific dApp in the abstract, we do in practice

come on...many individual pieces of the ethereum defi stack are raising millions at $20m+ valuations. If you credibly promised to replicate that stack on Bitcoin, you'd have investors throwing $100m+ at you, and there'd be immediate usage of the stack.

3/ for example, you can already make use of ethereum’s virtual machine with bitcoin, and you can make use of lightning network with ETH (or very soon will be, not sure of where this is in implementation, but it’s proven.)
Very cool integration across networks. A bitcoin lightning transaction triggers a change in an ethereum smart contract. Any other dApps making use of this for anything non-financial?
Doesn’t the same apply to any large initial stake? Consider that the ethereum foundation and Zcash co spent most of their allocations, redistributing those too.

#Ethereum was also < 1/100th as extractive as @venmo: "customers spent just $827,000, in network fees, to transfer more than $37 billion. Over this same period, fees & fees on associated services paid to Venmo are expected to reach $150M." -@TradeBlock

#Ethereum's on-chain stablecoin transaction volumes surpassed @venmo's total payment volume in Q2 2019: https://tradeblock.com/blog/stablecoin-on-chain-transaction-volumes-soar-outpace-venmo (h/t @evan_van_ness)
Really excited to welcome @ethereum Foundation's @mi_ayako to the @EntEthAlliance board, and the new #mainnet initiative.

Kudos to @metamask_io for always putting a premium on privacy and security. In their browser extension & new mobile app, 'Privacy Mode' is enabled by default. EIP-1102 requires sites and dApps to ask permission for access to a user's #Ethereum address.

The @AlethioEthstats team analyzed unusual @MakerDAO activity this past week, and concluded that @coinbase Earn's $DAI module caused a massive, unprecedented spike in CDP creation. Another indicator of #Ethereum #DeFi applications gaining momentum.

Are you an #Ethereum smart contract developer, and just can't find a trustworthy compiler with formal semantics? Then does @ConsenSys have the formally-verified EVM compiler for you! Say hello to Elle, and goodbye to bugs.
